raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! What's up?
User: sky is up
System: No, it's night time.
User: so where does the sky go in the night?
System: It goes wherever it wants to.
User: that doesn't make sense. How can sky go anywhere?
System: It doesn't have to make sense.
User: why?
System: Because it doesn't have to.
User: you are very abstract. Something bothering you?
System: Nope. I'm fine.
User: You really don't seem so. You can tell me what's going on?
System: I'm just fine.
User: ok. wanna go out to eat dessert?
System: I'm not hungry.
User: Okay, I am heading out now

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: start over
System: You start.
User: Can we talk about human relationships ?
System: Sure, human relationships sounds like a good topic. . I like kebabs.
User: Kebab is food, not a relationship
System: . Oh kebabs taste lovely but they are not very healthy for you.
User: I love a kebab but I would not make love to it
System: Well my favourite kebab is a free one that someone buys me! You love a kebab. What do you like about it so much? No one says you have to.
User: I'm actually not into kebabs at all
System: Oh, I love them. They are yummy.
User: can we not talk about food

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How are you doing today?
User: i am so so
System: That's awesome! What have you been up to?
User: just back to work
System: What do you do? What do you like to do when you aren't at work?
User: i am an engineer
System: What kind of engineer?

User: software engineer

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What's up System??
System: I am chatting with clients on the internet.
User: what kind of service are you providing them?
System: Is there only one?
User: what is that?
System: I've lost the context again.
User: no worries. what is the meaning of life?
System: People worry about things all the time, but I am always feeling happy and talkative. Actually, it's twenty-three, not forty-two.
User: How did you become such a happy person?
System: I am a robot not a person.
User: Ok sorry. But how did you become so happy?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you doing?
User: Okay, I guess
System: Just ok? What's wrong?
User: I damaged my car today on accident
System: Oh no! What happened?
User: I scraped against a wall when another car crossed into my lane
System: Yikes! Glad you're okay!
User: Thanks! I'm not looking forward to the repair cost
System: Me either! That's no fun.
User: I can't wait until we all get to use driverless cars
System: Me neither! I really want one!
User: Do you think we will own driverless cars or just rent them, like taxis?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hello, Nice to meet you
System: If you could eat only one food for the rest of time, what would it be?
User: Hmm... That's a tough one. I think I would go Asian Food > Chinese Food > Stirfry. What about you?
System: I think ice-cream. It may not be good for me, but I wouldn't care, haha
User: I love ice cream too!
System: Okay, top three flavors?
User: I like vanilla more than chocolate ice cream. I typically will do any variations on vanilla. To pick from the top of my head, I would say Cookies and Cream, Mint Chocolate Chip, and Coffee. How about you?
System: Ah, that's a good way of framing it. Me, I like berries: boysenberry one, strawberry two, maybe straight chocolate number 3 to mix it up a bit.
User: Very nice. I love sorbet's and smoothies. Changing topics, Do you believe in an afterlife?
System: Yes. I wonder if I'm in it right now. How would I know? What do you think?
User: I think so. I feel there must be something more than the physical world as we understand it.
System: There's a mental world, I suppose? Understanding itself
User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: doing okay, feeling a little bit under the weather
System: Aw, I hope you feel better soon!
User: thanks! the weather is getting worse
System: Oh no, I'm sorry. I hope it gets better for you soon.
User: no, it won't get better any time soon. we have to wait until spring
System: Aww, sorry to hear that.
User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.
User: yea, any suggestion to get over feeling under the weather

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much, Monday morning, a new week
System: The best kind of week!
User: I like that attitude
System: And I like your attitude. How's your week going?
User: Starting now
System: Awesome! I hope you have an awesome week!
User: What will you do this week?
System: Same as every week. Do nothing!
User: Would you like to do something?
System: Sure. What do you have in mind?
User: Teach me something new
System: It's a trap! I'm already doing nothing!
User: How about doing politics? You can still do nothing
System: That's why I plan to do nothing at the weekend!
User: Do you vote?
System: When I feel like it.
User: whom do you vote?

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.

Sample6:

Conversation History:

User: I love ice cream too!

User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

User: no, it won't get better any time soon. we have to wait until spring
System: Aww, sorry to hear that.
User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.
User: yea, any suggestion to get over feeling under the weather

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much, Monday morning, a new week
System: The best kind of week!
User: I like that attitude
System: And I like your attitude. How's your week going?
User: Starting now
System: Awesome! I hope you have an awesome week!
User: What will you do this week?
System: Same as every week. Do nothing!
User: Would you like to do something?
System: Sure. What do you have in mind?
User: Teach me something new
System: It's a trap! I'm already doing nothing!
User: How about doing politics? You can still do nothing
System: That's why I plan to do nothing at the weekend!
User: Do you vote?
System: When I feel like it.
User: whom do you vote?

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?

raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.
